member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.ArclBase.responseTimeout
member.summary: The amount of time (milliseconds) to wait for a resonse given to a sent command. If this is less than 0 it will block the calling Thread until a response is received. This may be a problem if no response will be received due to a loss of connection. In this case the calling Thread will be blocked indefinitely long. If the timeout exceeds before a response has been received, an Exception is thrown.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.ArclBase.sendable
member.summary: Specifies whether the object is able to send commands.

member.name: P:Mobile.Communication.Common.ArclBase.SequentialEventRaising
member.summary: Determines whether events will be raised sequentially (one by one). If the next event will be raised when the user code of the previous one is finished. Set this to to be able to wait in one event for another. This is by default for backwards compatibility (same behavior as before).

member.name: P:Mobile.Communication.Common.ArclBase.AsyncEventRaising
member.summary: Determines whether events will be raised on the interpreting . If each event will be raised inside the interpreting . Set this to to raise events from a threadpool . Like this you are able to call another function within the event handling method. This is by default for backwards compatibility (same behavior as before).

member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time (milliseconds) to wait for a resonse given to a sent command. If this is less than 0 it will block the calling Thread until a response is received. This may be a problem if no response will be received due to a loss of connection. In this case the calling Thread will be blocked indefinitely long. If the timeout exceeds before a response has been received, an Exception is thrown.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotStatusOnEM.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown status of this robot.

member.summary: Robot is available to be used by the Enterprise Manager.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotStatusOnEM.UnAvailable
member.summary: Robot is NOT available to be used by the Enterprise Manager.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotStatusOnEM.InProgress
member.summary: The is currently executing a job.

member.name: T:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM
member.summary: SubStatus of an Adept Lynx on the Enterprise Manager.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown substate.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.Available
member.summary: Robot is available to be used by the Enterprise Manager.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.NotUsingEnterpriseManager
member.summary: This robot is not using an Enterprise Manager. The Enterprise Manager will not use this robot to fullfill tasks.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.UnknownBatteryType
member.summary: Battery level could not be determined.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.ForcedDocked
member.summary: The robot is forced to dock. Maybe the battery status is too low.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.Lost
member.summary: The robot does not know where it is. It can not localize itself on the map.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.EStopPressed
member.summary: The EmergenyStop button is pressed (and not released).

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.Interrupted
member.summary: The robot has been interrupted. For example if an ESTOP has been pressed.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.InterruptedButNotYetIdle
member.summary: The robot has been interrupted and the reason for being interrupted is not active anymore (for example motors are enabled again after an ESTOP). However the robot is not yet ready to perform the next command from QueuingManager.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.OutgoingARCLConnLost
member.summary: Outgoing ARCL connection has been lost.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.Parking
member.summary: The robot is parking.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.Parked
member.summary: The robot is parked.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.DockParking
member.summary: The robot is docking instead of parking. Either because the battery level dropped beyond ParkLowStateOfCharge or no more standy goals are available.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.DockParked
member.summary: The robot docked instead of parked. Either because the battery level dropped beyond ParkLowStateOfCharge or no more standy goals are available.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.ModeIsLocked
member.summary: The robot's mode has been locked. So the QueuingManager cannot access the robot.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.UnAllocated
member.summary: Route to target not yet planned.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.Allocated
member.summary: Route is planned.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.Driving
member.summary: Driving to goal.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.RobotSubStatusOnEM.Custom
member.summary: A custom status is applied (like fault name).

member.summary: The ForcedStates enumeration.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.ForcedStates.Unknown
member.summary: Undefined ForcedState.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.ForcedStates.Forced
member.summary: Forced means the robot is forced to do something (for example dock, if battery is empty).

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.ForcedStates.Unforced
member.summary: The oposite of "Forced", the robot behaves like this because it is told to do so by commands.

member.name: T:Mobile.Communication.Common.ChargeStates
member.summary: The ChargeStates enumeration.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.ChargeStates.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown ChargeState.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.ChargeStates.Unknowable
member.summary: Undefined ChargeState.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.ChargeStates.Not
member.summary: Actually not charging.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.ChargeStates.Bulk
member.summary: Bulk charging (maximum charge current allowed for the cells). The robot is getting the most current into the battery.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.ChargeStates.Overcharge
member.summary: Overcharging battery to ensure full capacity. The robot is getting some current, but less than Bulk (normally based on voltage at that point or something).

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.ChargeStates.Float
member.summary: Full battery, just charge to capacity against self discharging. The robot is doing a maintenance charge, keeping the state of charge at 100% or something.

member.name: F:Mobile.Communication.Common.ChargeStates.Balance
member.summary: Slowly loading battery to nearly 100% of capacity.

member.name: P:Mobile.Communication.Common.IArclBase.ResponseTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time (milliseconds) to wait for a resonse given to a sent command. If this is less than 0 it will block the calling Thread until a response is received. This may be a problem if no response will be received due to a loss of connection. In this case the calling Thread will be blocked indefinitely long. If the timeout exceeds before a response has been received, an Exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Mobile.Communication.Common.IRobot.Go
member.summary: Sends the go command to the robot. This can either: clear faults -or- terminate wait tasks (like waitActive or stay). PLEASE NOTE THAT - UNLIKE ALL OTHER METHODS - THIS METHOD DOES NOT WAIT FOR A RESPONSE FROM THE ROBOT!!! THIS METHOD DIRECTLY RETURNS AFTER SENDING THE COMMAND. This is because there are situations where go does not get a return message (e.g. when robot is idle).

member.name: M:Mobile.Communication.Common.Robot.Go
member.summary: Sends the go command to the robot. This can either: clear faults -or- terminate wait tasks (like waitActive or stay). PLEASE NOTE THAT - UNLIKE ALL OTHER METHODS - THIS METHOD DOES NOT WAIT FOR A RESPONSE FROM THE ROBOT!!! THIS METHOD DIRECTLY RETURNS AFTER SENDING THE COMMAND. This is because there are situations where go does not get a return message (e.g. when robot is idle).
